type.description:
Type of criterion.

- criteria: Group of criteria or conditions.
- syndrome: Syndrome (defined by another definition, but used here as a criterion).
- symptom: just a symptom.
- diagnosis: The diagnosed disease, which may or may not be followed by a code, e.g. ICD.
- diagnostic_test: Tests or medical examinations to confirm a diagnosis, e.g. gluplasma glucose.
- professional_judgment: Professional assessment.
- epidemiological_history: Travel history or contact with someone with an epidemiological link.
- demographic_criteria: Factors such as age or sex.

logical_operator.description:
Keywords that represent a logical operation on criteria.

AND: All conditions in this group must be satisfied (true).
OR: At least one condition in this group must be satisfied.
AND_NOT: All conditions in this group must not be satisfied (must be false).
AT_LEAST: Used with the number specified in `logical_operator_arguments`. At least that many conditions must be true.

logical_operator_arguments.description: Used with `logical_operator = AT_LEAST`. At least that many conditions must be true.

value.description: The reference value for the referred attribute. It has no type because it could be anything.
examples: abnormal but non-specific bowel gas pattern

description.description: A detailed description of the criterion.

operator.description:
Comparison operators.

>: Value must be greater than the specified threshold.
>=: Value must be greater than or equal to the specified threshold.
<: Value must be less than the specified threshold.
<=: Value must be less than or equal to the specified threshold.
==: Value must exactly match the specified value.
!=: Value must not match the specified value.
regex: Value must match the specified regular expression pattern.

regex_pattern.description: Regular expression for evaluation and pattern matching.

regex_flags.description: Regular expression flags for extra configuration.

display.description: A label that represents this code.

description.description: Detailed description of a case definition.

scope.description: A broad definition aims to capture most or all true cases, while a specific definition provides a more accurate description but risks missing some true cases.

category.description: Case definition categories according to Bassil, K. (2008). Case definition. In Encyclopedia of epidemiology (Vol. 2, pp. 133-134). SAGE Publications, Inc., https://doi.org/10.4135/9781412953948

version.description: Case definition version to be defined by the author but following the Semantic Versioning Specification (https://semver.org/).

published_in.description: URL where the narrative format definition was originally published or can be found.

published_at.description: Date and time of publication at Open Syndrome Initiative website (UTC).

published_by.description: List of the case definition publishers in the Open Syndrome Initiative.

location.description: Free text for location input; recommended format is 'City, State/Region, Country' following geographical hierarchy with comma separation

organization.description: The organization responsible for this case definition maintenance.
examples: The Epidemic Intelligence from Open Sources Initiative

authors.description: People or organizations that authored this case definition.

notes.description: Any notes that may be relevant to this case definition.

references.description: References which have supported this definition followed by a URL.

status.description: Current status of this definition in the Open Syndrome Initiative platform.

human_readable_definition.description: A human-readable definition of the case definition, which can be used for display purposes in user interfaces.

target_public_health_threats.description: List of public health threats that this case definition targets.
